message.content: The generated code currently stores users and chats in memory, which means that all data will be lost when the server is restarted. A better approach would be to use a database to persist this data. This would allow the data to survive server restarts and also make it easier to handle multiple simultaneous requests.

message.content: The test for the login function is failing because it's creating a new user with the register endpoint before trying to log in, which results in a different user ID each time. Instead of creating a new user for each test, it would be better to create a setup function that creates a test user and logs them in, and use this setup function for each test that requires a logged-in user. This would ensure that the same user is used for each test, making the tests more reliable and easier to understand.

message.content: The test for the login function is still failing. This is because the user fixture is creating a new user for each test that uses it, resulting in a different user ID each time. To fix this, you could modify the user fixture to only create a new user if one doesn't already exist. This would ensure that the same user is used for each test, making the tests more reliable and easier to understand.
